header.desc: Kolab is a groupware used in the german administration

element.name: age
element.title: Age
element.desc0: less than 3 months
element.desc1: if between 3 months and 3 years
element.desc2: after 3 years
element.comment: Kolab.org domain was created the 29th of Oct 2002

element.name: stability
element.title: Stability
element.desc0: Unstable software with numerous releases or patches generating side effects
element.desc1: Stabilized production release existing but old. Difficulties to stabilize developpement releases
element.desc2: Stabilized software. Releases provide bug fixes corrections but mainly new functionalities

element.name: historyknowproblems
element.title: History, know problems
element.desc0: Software knows several problems which can be prohibitive
element.desc1: No know major problem or crisis
element.desc2: History of good management of crisis situations

element.name: forkprobability
element.title: Fork probability, source of Forking
element.desc0: Software is very likely to be forked in the future
element.desc1: Software comes from a fork but has very few chances of being forked in the future
element.desc2: Software has very little chance of being forked. It does not come from a fork either

element.name: popularity
element.title: Popularity (related to: general public, niche, ...)
element.desc0: Very few users identified
element.desc1: Detectable use on Internet
element.desc2: Numerous users, numerous references

element.name: references
element.title: References
element.desc0: None
element.desc1: Few refences, non critical usages
element.desc2: Often implemented for critical applications
element.comment: Kolab is know to be use in some important organisation. But they doesn't give information for "security" raison

element.name: contributingcommunity
element.title: Contributing Community
element.desc0: No community or without real activity (forum, mailing list, ...)
element.desc1: Existing community with a notable activity
element.desc2: Strong community: big activity on forums, numerous contributors and advocates

element.name: books
element.title: books
element.desc0: No book about the software
element.desc1: Less than 5 books about the software are available
element.desc2: More than 5 books about software are available, in several languages

element.name: leadingteam
element.title: Leading team
element.desc0: 1 to 2 individuals involved, not clearly identified
element.desc1: Between 2 and 5 independent people
element.desc2: More than 5 people

element.name: managementstyle
element.title: Management style
element.desc0: Complete dictatorship
element.desc1: Enlightened despotism
element.desc2: Council of architects with identified leader (e.g: KDE)

element.name: activity
element.title: Activity
element.desc: Activity of the project and around the software

element.name: developersidentificationturnover
element.title: Developers, identification, turnover
element.desc0: Less than 3 developers, not clearly identified
element.desc1: Between 4 and 7 developers, or more unidentified developers with important turnover
element.desc2: More than 7 developers, very stable team

element.name: activityonbugs
element.title: Activity on bugs
element.desc0: Slow reactivity in forum or on mailing list, or nothing regarding bug fixes in releases note
element.desc1: Detectable activity but without process clearly exposed, loing reaction/resolution time
element.desc2: Strong reactivity based on roles and tasks assignment

element.name: activityonfunctionalities
element.title: Activity on functionalities
element.desc0: No or few new functionalities
element.desc1: Evolution of the product driven by the core team or by user's request without any clearly explained process
element.desc2: Tool(s) to manage feature requests, strong interaction with roadmap

element.name: activityonreleases
element.title: Activity on releases
element.desc0: Very weak activity on both production and development releases
element.desc1: Activity on production and developmenet releases. Frequent minor releases (bug fixes)
element.desc2: Important activity with frequent minor releases (bugs fixes) and planned major releases relating to the roadmap forcast

element.name: independenceofdevelopments
element.title: Independence of developments
element.desc0: Developments realized at 100% by employees of a single company
element.desc1: 60% maximum
element.desc2: 20% maximum

element.name: training
element.title: Training
element.desc0: No offer of training identified
element.desc1: Offer exists but is restricted geographically and to one language or is provided by a single contractor
element.desc2: Rich offers provided by several contractors, in serveral languages and split into modules of gradual levels

element.name: support
element.title: Support
element.desc0: No offer of support except via public forums and mailing lists
element.desc1: Offer exists but is provided by a single contractor without strong commitment quality of services
element.desc2: Multiple service providers with strong commitment (e.g: guaranteed resolution time)

element.name: consulting
element.title: Consulting
element.desc0: No offer of consulting service
element.desc1: Offer exists but is restricted geographically and to one language or is provided by a single contractor
element.desc2: Consulting services provided by different contractors in serveral languages

element.name: documentation
element.title: Documentation
element.desc0: No user documentation
element.desc1: Documentation exists but shifted in time, is restricted to one language or is poorly detailed
element.desc2: Documentation always up to date, translated and possibly adapted to different target readers (end user, sysadmin, manager, ...)

element.name: quality
element.title: Quality Assurance
element.desc0: No QA process
element.desc1: Identifies QA process but not much formalized and with no tool
element.desc2: Automatic testing process included in code's life-cycle with publication of results

element.name: tools
element.title: Tools
element.desc0: No bug or feature request management tool
element.desc1: Standard tools provided (for instance by a hosting forge) but poorly used
element.desc2: Very active use of tools for roles/tasks allocation and progress monitoring

element.name: packagingsource
element.title: Source
element.desc0: Software can't be installed from source without lot of work
element.desc1: Installation from source is limited and depends on very strict conditions (OS, arch, lib, ...)
element.desc2: Installation from source is easy

element.name: packagingdebian
element.title: Debian
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for Debian
element.desc1: A Debian package exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: The software is packaged in the distribution

element.name: packagingfreebsd
element.title: FreeBSD
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for FreeBSD
element.desc1: A port exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: A official port exists in FreeBSD

element.name: packaginghpux
element.title: HP-UX
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for HP-UX
element.desc1: A package exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: A stable package is provided for HP-UX

element.name: packagingmacosx
element.title: MacOSX
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for MacOSX
element.desc1: A package exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: The software is packaged in the distribution

element.name: packagingmandriva
element.title: Mandriva
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for Mandriva
element.desc1: A package exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: The software is packaged in the distribution

element.name: packagingnet
element.title: NetBSD
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for NetBSD
element.desc1: A port exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: A official port exists in NetBSD

element.name: packagingopen
element.title: OpenBSD
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for OpenBSD
element.desc1: A port exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: A official port exists in OpenBSD

element.name: packagingredhat
element.title: RedHat
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for RedHat/Fedora
element.desc1: A package exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: The software is packaged in the distribution

element.name: packagingsolaris
element.title: Solaris
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for Solaris
element.desc1: A package exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support (e.g: SunFreeware.com )
element.desc2: The software is supported by Sun for Solaris

element.name: packagingsuse
element.title: SuSE
element.desc0: The software is not packaged for SuSE
element.desc1: A package exists but it has important issues or it doesn't have official support
element.desc2: The software is packaged in the distribution

element.name: packagingwindows
element.title: Windows
element.desc0: The project can't be installed on Windows
element.desc1: A package exists but it is limited or has important issues or just cover some specific Windows release (e.g: Windows2000 and WindowsXP)
element.desc2: Windows is full supported and a package is provided

element.name: easeofuseergonomics
element.title: Ease of use, ergonomics
element.desc0: Difficult to use, requires an in depth knowledge of the software functionality
element.desc1: Austere and very technical ergonomics
element.desc2: GUI including help functions and elaborated ergonomics

element.name: administrationmonitoring
element.title: Administration / Monitoring
element.desc0: No administrative or monitoring functionalities
element.desc1: Existing, functionalities but uncomplete and or need improvement
element.desc2: Complete and easy-to-use administration and monitoring functionalities. Possible integration with external tools (e.g: SNMP, syslog, ...)

element.name: modularity
element.title: Modularity
element.desc0: Monolithic software
element.desc1: Presence of hight level modules allowing a first level of software adaptation
element.desc2: Modular conception, allowing easy adaptation of the software by selecting or creating modules

element.name: codemodification
element.title: Code modification
element.desc0: Everything by hand
element.desc1: Recompilation possible but complex without any tools or documentation
element.desc2: Recompilation with tools (e.g: make, ANT, ...) and documentation provided

element.name: codeextension
element.title: Code extention
element.desc0: Any modification requires code recompilation
element.desc1: Architecture designed for static extension but requires recompilation
element.desc2: Principle of plugin, architecture designed for dynamic extension without recompilation

element.name: permissiveness
element.title: Permissiveness (only if user wants to become owner of code)
element.desc0: Very strict license, like GPL
element.desc1: Moderate permissive license located between both extremes (GPL and BSD) dual-licensing depending on the type of user (person, company, ...) or their activities
element.desc2: Very permissive like BSD or Apache licenses

element.name: protectionagainstproprietaryforks
element.title: Protection against proprietary forks
element.desc0: Very permissive like BSD or Apache licenses
element.desc1: Moderate permissive license located between both extremes (GPL and BSD), dual-licensing depending on the type of user (person, company, ...) or their activies
element.desc2: Very strict license, like GPL

element.name: copyrightowners
element.title: Copyright owners
element.desc0: Rights held by a few individuals or entities, making it easier to change the license
element.desc1: Rights held by numerous individuals owning the code in a homogeneous way, making relicense very difficult
element.desc2: Rights held by a legal entity in whom the community trusts (e.g: FSF or ASF)

element.name: modificationofsourcecode
element.title: Modification of source code
element.desc0: No pratical way to propose code modification
element.desc1: Tools provided to access and modify code (like CVS or SVN) but not really used to develop the software
element.desc2: The code modification process is well defined, exposed and respected, based on roles assignment

element.name: roadmap
element.title: Roadmap
element.desc0: No published roadmap
element.desc1: Existing roadmap without planning
element.desc2: Versionned roadmap, with planning and measure of delays

element.name: sponsor
element.title: Sponsor
element.desc0: Software has no sponsor, the core team is not paid
element.desc1: Software has an unique sponsor who might determine its strategy
element.desc2: Software is sponsored by industry

element.name: strategicalindependence
element.title: Strategical independence
element.desc0: No detectable strategy or strong dependency on one unique actor (person, company, sponsor)
element.desc1: Strategical vision shared with several other free and open source projects but without strong commitment from copyrights owners
element.desc2: Strong independence of the code team, legal entity holding rights, strong involvement in the standardization process

element.name: storage
element.title: Storage backend
element.comment: Content is stored in IMAP shared folder

element.name: webinterface
element.title: Web interface
element.desc0: No web interface
element.desc1: an web interface is provided but limited
element.desc2: everything can be completed with the Web interface

element.name: commandline
element.title: Console mode
element.desc0: Nothing
element.desc1: Some tools exists, but limited. No text based configuration file or not human readable (e.g: complexe XML)
element.desc2: Total access to the server configuration with powerful tools and well designer text configuration file

element.name: standaloneadmintool
element.title: Stand alone admin tool
element.desc0: Nothing
element.desc1: A limited tool exist allow user to do specific operation
element.desc2: A powerful tool give access to every major features of the server

element.name: calendar
element.title: Calendar
element.desc0: no calendar provided
element.desc1: a calendar is provided, but leak some important features
element.desc2: a well integrated calendar is provided

element.name: taskmanager
element.title: Taskmanager
element.desc0: no task manager provided
element.desc1: a task manager is provided but leak some important features
element.desc2: Task manager fully supported

element.name: notemanager
element.title: Notemanager
element.desc0: no note manager provided
element.desc1: a limited note manager is provided
element.desc2: a well integred note manager is provided

element.name: contactmanager
element.title: Contact manager
element.desc0: can't add contact in the server
element.desc1: contact manager exists but is limited
element.desc2: contact manager fully supported

element.name: icaloverwebdav
element.title: iCalendar over WebDav
element.desc0: iCalendar over WebDav is not supported
element.desc1: iCalendar over WebDav is partially supported
element.desc2: iCalendar over WebDav works

element.name: caldav
element.title: CalDav
element.desc0: CalDav is not supported
element.desc1: CalDav is partially supported
element.desc2: CalDav works

element.name: groupdav
element.title: Groupdav
element.desc0: Groupdav is not supported
element.desc1: Groupdav is partially supported
element.desc2: Groupdav works

element.name: syncml
element.title: SyncML
element.desc0: SyncML is not supported
element.desc1: SyncML is partially supported
element.desc2: SyncML works

element.name: web
element.title: Web client
element.desc0: Web interface doesn't exist
element.desc1: Web interface is provided but limited or need some work for its integration
element.desc2: Web interface directly provided with the project
element.comment: eGroupware or Hord can be pluged

element.name: outlook
element.title: Microsoft Outlook
element.desc0: Microsoft Outlook not supported
element.desc1: Microsoft Outlook connector is provided but have some limitation
element.desc2: a free Microsoft Outlook connector
element.comment: Two commercial and not free connected exist. The best is Toltec's one.

element.name: evolution
element.title: Novell Evolution
element.desc0: Novell Evolution can't be used
element.desc1: Novell Evolution can be used but with some limitation
element.desc2: Novell Evolution fully supported

element.name: kde
element.title: KDE
element.desc0: KDE PIM (Korganizer, kmail, ...) can't be used with this groupware
element.desc1: KDE can be used but with some limitation
element.desc2: Fully support of KDE
element.comment: KDE PIM was the first supported client

element.name: ical
element.title: Apple iCal
element.desc0: Apple's iCal can't be used
element.desc1: Apple's iCal works but with some limitation
element.desc2: Apple's iCal fully supported

element.name: loadbalancing
element.title: Load balancing
element.desc0: This software can't be loadbalancer
element.desc1: Part of the installation can be splited but it keeps important bottleneck
element.desc2: Loadblalancing just works
element.desc: Can the load be splited between different computer?

element.name: remoteapi
element.title: Remote access API
element.desc0: No remote remote API
element.desc1: remote API (SOAP, XML/RPC, REST) exists but is limited or buggy
element.desc2: powerful remote API (SOAP, XML/RPC, REST) provided
element.comment: none for Kolab2, a wish for Kolab3 exists for support of a remote procedure call infrastucture

element.name: api
element.title: unified API
element.desc0: No API provided to extend the server, or very limited and not documented
element.desc1: An API is provided but limited of not fully documented
element.desc2: Well documented and complet API
element.comment: A Perl lib is provided but Kolab core can't be change easily. The best way to extend it, is to provide additional service plugged on the LDAP directory server.
